article_title: 45,865 Have Selected Plans In 19 States, .7% Of Total First Year Goal

article_metadata.description: This week the Administration will release some form of enrollment data for the exchanges. Avik has compiled some early media coverage in his recent post, highlighting the fact that total enrollment appears to be around 100,000 nationally. The Foundation for Government Accountability (FGA) has surveyed local media stories, and exchange websites, in order to compiled that data by state for your reading pleasure in an interactive map. At the current ratio of those creating an account and actually making it to the selection of a plan, well over 95 million accounts would need to be started to hit their first year enrollment goals.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
